comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Prokudin-Gorskii followed the development of the autochrome closely. But he used a very different method to achieve color photographs. The technique involved multiple exposures of the same scene through blue, green, and red filters; then, combining the three images into a single, full color scene--either printed on paper, or, projected like a slide. This tricolor method was more time consuming than an autochrome, but it yielded vivid, lifelike color. For a full description of how the tricolor method worked, see www.loc.gov/pictures/collection/prok/process.html and www.loc.gov/exhibits/empire/making.html, which includes a picture of the camera. -- Helena (LOC)
